top_10_indian_recipes.name: Butter Chicken
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, chili powder, and salt for 2 hours.
Grill or pan-fry the chicken until cooked and set aside.
In a pan, melt butter and sauté onions until golden.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Add garam masala and cream, mix well.
Add the cooked chicken and simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with naan or rice.

top_10_indian_recipes.name: Biryani
steps: Wash and soak rice for 30 minutes.
Marinate meat with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, biryani masala, and salt for 1 hour.
In a pot, heat ghee/oil and fry onions until golden. Remove half for garnish.
Add marinated meat and cook until half done.
Add tomatoes, mint, and coriander. Cook for 5 minutes.
Layer half-cooked rice over the meat. Sprinkle fried onions and saffron milk.
Cover with tight lid and cook on low heat for 20 minutes (dum cooking).
Mix gently before serving.

top_10_indian_recipes.name: Palak Paneer
steps: Blanch spinach in hot water for 2 minutes, then blend to a puree.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add onions and sauté until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add spinach puree, turmeric, garam masala, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and cream. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with roti or naan.

top_10_indian_recipes.name: Masala Dosa
steps: Soak rice, dal, and fenugreek seeds for 6 hours. Grind to smooth batter and ferment overnight.
For filling: Heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and chilies.
Add onions and sauté until translucent. Add turmeric and mashed potatoes. Mix well.
To make dosa: Spread batter on hot tawa in circular motion to make thin crepe.
Drizzle oil and cook until crisp. Place potato filling on one side and fold.
Serve with coconut chutney and sambar.

top_10_indian_recipes.name: Chole Bhature
steps: Pressure cook chickpeas with tea bags until soft. Drain and discard tea bags.
Heat oil, sauté onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomato puree and spices. Cook until oil separates.
Add cooked chickpeas and simmer for 10 minutes. Add amchur at end.
For bhature: Mix all ingredients to make soft dough. Rest for 2 hours.
Roll into circles and deep fry until puffed and golden.
Serve hot chole with bhature and sliced onions.

top_10_indian_recipes.name: Rogan Josh
steps: Heat mustard oil until smoking point, then cool slightly.
Fry onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add lamb pieces and brown on all sides.
Whisk yogurt with spices and add to the meat. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add water, bay leaves, and salt. Cover and simmer until meat is tender (about 1 hour).
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with rice.

top_10_indian_recipes.name: Dhokla
steps: Mix gram flour, semolina, ginger-chili paste, turmeric, lemon juice, sugar, salt, and water to make batter.
Grease a steaming tray and keep ready.
Just before steaming, add fruit salt to batter and mix gently.
Pour into tray and steam for 15-20 minutes until cooked.
For tempering: Heat oil, add mustard seeds, chilies, and curry leaves. Pour over dhokla.
Garnish with coriander and serve with green chutney.

top_10_indian_recipes.name: Pav Bhaji
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (cauliflower, peas, carrots, beans)
Lemon wedges and chopped onions for serving
steps: Boil all vegetables until soft. Drain and mash coarsely.
Heat butter in a pan, sauté onions until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste, capsicum, and tomatoes. Cook until mushy.
Add mashed vegetables, pav bhaji masala, chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Cook for 10-15 minutes, mashing continuously. Add butter as needed.
Toast pav buns in butter until golden.
Serve hot bhaji with buttered pav, onions, and lemon wedges.

top_10_indian_recipes.name: Idli Sambar
steps: Soak rice and dal separately for 6 hours. Grind to smooth batter and ferment overnight.
Grease idli molds, pour batter and steam for 10 minutes.
For sambar: Cook dal and vegetables with turmeric until soft.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves. Add onions and sauté.
Add tomatoes, sambar powder, and tamarind pulp. Cook for 5 minutes.
Mix with cooked dal and vegetables. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot idlis with sambar and coconut chutney.

top_10_indian_recipes.name: Gulab Jamun
steps: Make sugar syrup by boiling sugar, water, and cardamom until slightly sticky. Add rose water and keep warm.
Mix milk powder, maida, and baking soda. Add ghee and enough milk to make soft dough.
Make small smooth balls without cracks.
Heat oil on low flame and fry balls until golden brown (keep flame low for even cooking).
Drain and immediately soak in warm sugar syrup for at least 2 hours.
Serve warm or chilled.
